Notification sent when all league members have submitted their picks

# Final Submission Notification

Sent when ALL members of a league have submitted their picks for a gameweek.

## Trigger Conditions

1. Client calls `notifyFinalSubmission` with `leagueId` and `matchday`
2. Function checks if ALL league members have submitted
3. If yes, sends notification to all members

## Audience

- ALL league members (including the person who just submitted)
- No preference key (always sent)
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "final_submission",
  "league_id": "uuid",
  "matchday": 16,
  "is_test_api": false
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: `All predictions submitted! `

**Body**: `Everyone in {leagueName} has submitted for {matchdayLabel}. Check out who picked what!`

Example:
- Title: `All predictions submitted! `
- Body: `Everyone in Weekend Warriors has submitted for GW 16. Check out who picked what!`

## Duplicate Prevention

Uses a special marker in `notification_state` table:
- `api_match_id` = `888888 - matchday - (league_hash % 10000)`
- `last_notified_status` = `FINAL_SUBMISSION`

Notification sent when someone sends a message in league chat

# Chat Message Notification

Sent when a user sends a message in a league chat.

## Trigger Conditions

1. User sends a message in league chat
2. Client calls `notifyLeagueMessage` Netlify function after message is inserted

## Audience

- All league members EXCEPT the sender
- MINUS users who have muted the specific league
- MINUS users who have disabled `chat-messages` globally
- MINUS users currently active in the chat (optional, via `activeUserIds` param)
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "league_message",
  "leagueId": "uuid",
  "leagueCode": "ABC123",
  "senderId": "uuid",
  "url": "/league/ABC123"
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: `{senderName}`

**Body**: `{messageContent}` (truncated to 180 chars)

Example:
- Title: `Carl`
- Body: `Nice picks everyone! Let's see how GW16 goes `

## Deep Link

Notification includes URL `/league/{leagueCode}` to open the league chat when tapped.

## Muting

Users can mute specific leagues via `league_notification_settings` table. This is checked before sending.

## Cooldown

30-second per-user cooldown prevents spam from rapid messages.

## Quiet Hours

Chat notifications are suppressed between 23:00 and 07:00 (user local time - requires timezone handling).

Chat Message Notification

Sent when a user sends a message in a league chat.

Trigger Conditions

  1. User sends a message in league chat
  2. Client calls notifyLeagueMessage Netlify function after message is inserted

Audience

  • All league members EXCEPT the sender
  • MINUS users who have muted the specific league
  • MINUS users who have disabled chat-messages globally
  • MINUS users currently active in the chat (optional, via activeUserIds param)
  • Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

Source of truth for all push notifications in the TOTL app

This is the **source of truth** for all push notifications in the TOTL application.

## Quick Links

- [Architecture](/architecture/) - Understand how the notification system works
- [Notifications](/notifications/goal-scored/) - Browse all notification types
- [Templates](/templates/en/) - View notification message templates

## Notification Types

| Type | Status | Description |
|------|--------|-------------|
| `goal-scored` |  Active | Goal scored in a match |
| `goal-disallowed` |  Active | VAR disallowed goal |
| `kickoff` |  Active | Match kickoff (1st/2nd half) |
| `half-time` |  Active | Half-time score update |
| `final-whistle` |  Active | Full-time result with pick outcome |
| `gameweek-complete` |  Active | All matches in GW finished |
| `chat-message` |  Active | League chat message |
| `final-submission` |  Active | All league members submitted picks |
| `new-gameweek` |  Active | New gameweek fixtures published |

## Key Features

- **Idempotency**: Every notification has a deterministic `event_id` to prevent duplicates
- **Preference Enforcement**: All user preferences are enforced server-side
- **Grouping**: OneSignal `collapse_id`, `thread_id`, and `android_group` are set on every push
- **Audit Log**: Every send attempt is logged in `notification_send_log`
- **Cooldowns**: Per-user cooldowns prevent notification spam
How the TOTL notification system works

# Notification Architecture

## System Overview

```

                              USER DEVICE (iOS)                              

      
                       DESPIA NATIVE WRAPPER                               
    - OneSignal Native SDK                                                 
    - Exposes: window.onesignalplayerid                                    
    - Handles: Push permission, device registration                        
      
                                                                            
                                                                            
      
     REACT WEB APP (WebView)                                               
     - Registers player_id with backend                                    
     - Manages user preferences                                            
     - Handles notification deep links                                     
      

                                    
                                    

                         NETLIFY FUNCTIONS                                   
      
                      UNIFIED DISPATCHER                                    
    - Receives notification intents                                         
    - Enforces idempotency (notification_send_log)                         
    - Enforces preferences, cooldowns, quiet hours                         
    - Targets OneSignal via external_user_id                               
    - Sets collapse_id, thread_id, android_group                           
    - Logs all send attempts                                                
      
                                                                            
                                                                            
                                                      
                      OneSignal REST API                                   
                      POST /notifications                                  
                                                      

                                    
                                    

                             SUPABASE                                        
      
   notification_send_log  push_subscriptions  user_notification_prefs     
   (idempotency + audit)  (device registry)   (user choices)              
      

```

## Dispatcher Flow

1. **Intent Received**: Trigger provides `notification_key`, `event_id`, `userIds[]`, and `data`
2. **Idempotency Check**: For each user, try to INSERT into `notification_send_log` 
   - If duplicate key error  skip (already sent)
   - If inserted  continue
3. **Policy Enforcement**:
   - Check user preferences in `user_notification_preferences`
   - Check cooldown (recent sends for same `notification_key`)
   - Check quiet hours (catalog metadata)
   - Check league mutes (for chat notifications)
4. **Targeting**: Resolve OneSignal targets (external_user_id or player_ids)
5. **Payload Build**: Set collapse_id, thread_id, android_group from catalog
6. **Send**: Call OneSignal API
7. **Log Result**: Update `notification_send_log` with outcome

## Event ID Format

Each notification type has a deterministic event_id format:

| Type | Format | Example |
|------|--------|---------|
| goal-scored | `goal:{api_match_id}:{scorer}:{minute}` | `goal:12345:Haaland:52` |
| kickoff | `kickoff:{api_match_id}:{half}` | `kickoff:12345:1` |
| half-time | `halftime:{api_match_id}` | `halftime:12345` |
| final-whistle | `ft:{api_match_id}` | `ft:12345` |
| gameweek-complete | `gw_complete:{gw}` | `gw_complete:16` |
| chat-message | `chat:{league_id}:{message_id}` | `chat:abc123:msg456` |
| final-submission | `final_sub:{league_id}:{gw}` | `final_sub:abc123:16` |
| new-gameweek | `new_gw:{gw}` | `new_gw:17` |

## OneSignal Grouping

Every notification includes grouping fields to prevent duplicate display:

| Field | Purpose | Example |
|-------|---------|---------|
| `collapse_id` | Replaces existing notification with same ID | `goal:12345` |
| `thread_id` | Groups iOS notifications by thread | `match:12345` |
| `android_group` | Groups Android notifications | `totl_scores` |
Notification sent when a match finishes with pick result

# Final Whistle Notification

Sent when a match finishes. Message is personalized based on whether the user's pick was correct.

## Trigger Conditions

1. Status changes to `FINISHED` or `FT`
2. Previous status was NOT `FINISHED` or `FT`
3. User has submitted a pick for this fixture

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
- Filtered by `final-whistle` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "game_finished",
  "api_match_id": 12345,
  "fixture_index": 3,
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: `FT: {homeTeam} {homeScore}-{awayScore} {awayTeam}`

**Body (correct pick)**: ` Got it right! {percentage}% of players got this fixture correct`

**Body (wrong pick)**: ` Wrong pick {percentage}% of players got this fixture correct`

Example:
- Title: `FT: Man United 2-1 Liverpool`
- Body: ` Got it right! Only 34% of players got this fixture correct`

## Personalization

Each user receives a personalized message based on:
1. Whether their pick (H/D/A) matches the result
2. Overall percentage of correct picks for this fixture

Notification sent when a match kicks off (1st or 2nd half)

# Kickoff Notification

Sent when a match kicks off. Separate notifications for first and second half.

## Trigger Conditions

**First Half Kickoff:**
1. Status changes to `IN_PLAY`
2. Score is 0-0
3. Not already notified for this match kickoff

**Second Half Kickoff:**
1. Previous status was `PAUSED` or `HALF_TIME`
2. Status changes to `IN_PLAY`
3. Not already notified for second half

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
- Filtered by `score-updates` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "kickoff",
  "api_match_id": 12345,
  "fixture_index": 3,
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: ` {homeTeam} vs {awayTeam}`

**Body (1st half)**: `Kickoff!`

**Body (2nd half)**: `Second half underway`

  3. Not already notified for second half

Notification sent when all matches in a gameweek have finished

# Gameweek Complete Notification

Sent when ALL matches in a gameweek have finished.

## Trigger Conditions

1. A match status changes to `FINISHED`
2. System checks if ALL fixtures in that GW are now `FINISHED`
3. No recent notification sent for this GW (1-hour check)
4. `notification_state.last_notified_status` not already `GW_FINISHED`

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for any fixture in the gameweek
- Filtered by `gw-results` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "gameweek_finished",
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: ` Gameweek {gw} Complete!`

**Body**: `All games finished. Check your results!`

Example:
- Title: ` Gameweek 16 Complete!`
- Body: `All games finished. Check your results!`

## Side Effects

When all games finish, the system also:
1. Writes results to `app_gw_results` table
2. Updates `notification_state` with `GW_FINISHED` status

Notification sent when a goal is scored in a tracked match

# Goal Scored Notification

Sent when a goal is scored in a match that the user has made picks for.

## Trigger Conditions

1. `live_scores` table is updated via Supabase webhook
2. Goals array has new entries compared to `notification_state.last_notified_goals`
3. Score has not decreased (that would trigger `goal-disallowed` instead)

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
- Filtered by `score-updates` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "goal",
  "api_match_id": 12345,
  "fixture_index": 3,
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: `{teamName} scores!`

**Body**: `{minute}' {scorer}\n{homeTeam} [{homeScore}] - {awayScore} {awayTeam}`

Example: 
- Title: `Man United scores!`
- Body: `52' Marcus Rashford\nMan United [2] - 1 Liverpool`

## Duplicate Prevention

- Event ID includes scorer name (normalized) and minute to distinguish different goals
- `notification_state.last_notified_goals` tracks which goals have been notified
- 2-minute TTL prevents re-notifying for same goal event

Notification sent at half-time with current score

# Half-Time Notification

Sent when a match reaches half-time (status changes from IN_PLAY to PAUSED).

## Trigger Conditions

1. Previous status was `IN_PLAY`
2. Status changes to `PAUSED`
3. `notification_state.last_notified_status` is not already `PAUSED`

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
- No preference key (always sent if user has picks)
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "half_time",
  "api_match_id": 12345,
  "fixture_index": 3,
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: ` Half-Time`

**Body**: `{homeTeam} {homeScore}-{awayScore} {awayTeam} {minute}'`

Example:
- Title: ` Half-Time`
- Body: `Man United 1-1 Liverpool 45+3'`

  1. Previous status was IN_PLAY
  2. Status changes to PAUSED
  3. notification_state.last_notified_status is not already PAUSED

Audience

  • All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
  • No preference key (always sent if user has picks)

Notification sent when a goal is disallowed by VAR

# Goal Disallowed Notification

Sent when a previously counted goal is disallowed (typically by VAR review).

## Trigger Conditions

1. `live_scores` table is updated via Supabase webhook
2. Score has **decreased** compared to previous state
3. This indicates a goal was disallowed/overturned

## Audience

- All users who have submitted picks for the fixture
- Filtered by `score-updates` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "goal_disallowed",
  "api_match_id": 12345,
  "fixture_index": 3,
  "gw": 16
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: ` Goal Disallowed`

**Body**: `{minute}' {scorer}'s goal for {teamName} was disallowed by VAR\n{homeTeam} {homeScore}-{awayScore} {awayTeam}`

Example:
- Title: ` Goal Disallowed`
- Body: `52' Rashford's goal for Man United was disallowed by VAR\nMan United 1-1 Liverpool`

# New Gameweek Notification

Broadcast notification sent to all users when new gameweek fixtures are published.

## Trigger Conditions

1. Admin triggers `sendPushAll` function with `new-gameweek` type
2. Typically triggered after fixtures are loaded into `app_fixtures`

## Audience

- ALL users with active push subscriptions
- Filtered by `new-gameweek` preference
- Filtered by OneSignal subscription status

## Payload Data

```json
{
  "type": "new-gameweek"
}
```

## Message Template

**Title**: Custom (set by admin)

**Body**: Custom (set by admin)

Typical example:
- Title: ` Gameweek 17 is live!`
- Body: `Fixtures are now available. Make your picks before kickoff!`

## iOS Badge

This notification sets `ios_badgeCount: 1` to show a badge on the app icon.

## Admin-Only

This notification type can only be triggered by admins via the `sendPushAll` function. It is not automatically triggered by any system event.
